roadmap_steps: Research IHC's real estate portfolio and sustainability goals
Prepare tailored proposals for green technology deployment
Engage with IHC's sustainability and operations teams
Pilot selected technologies on flagship properties
Scale successful solutions across IHC projects

opportunities.title: Healthcare Sustainability Solutions Collaboration
opportunities.description: Sustainable healthcare technology providers can team up with IHC to offer eco-friendly healthcare solutions—like solar-powered clinics, energy-efficient medical devices, or green hospital waste management—in line with IHC’s ESG objectives and healthcare investment strategy.
roadmap_steps: Identify green healthcare technology providers
Assess IHC’s existing healthcare portfolio and needs
Develop pilot implementation plan for sustainable solutions
Measure impact on ESG metrics and patient outcomes
Expand deployment upon success

opportunities.title: Renewable Energy Project Financing Partnerships
opportunities.description: Financial service providers or green investment funds can collaborate with IHC by structuring and co-financing renewable energy projects or assets, leveraging IHC’s commitment to sustainable investment and the UAE Vision 2030/2031.
roadmap_steps: Identify pipeline renewable energy projects with IHC
Design joint investment structures or green bonds
Align financing with ESG and government objectives
Secure regulatory and stakeholder approvals
Deploy funds and monitor project outcomes

opportunities.title: Sustainable Agriculture and Food Chain Innovations
opportunities.description: Agri-tech companies developing precision farming, water-saving irrigation, or supply chain traceability tech can partner with IHC to implement these systems in IHC's food and agriculture subsidiaries, boosting sustainability and food security metrics.
roadmap_steps: Analyze IHC's food and agriculture operations
Scout agri-tech startups and established solution providers
Propose pilot programs in water-saving and traceability
Collect performance data for ESG reporting
Expand adoption based on demonstrable impact

opportunities.title: Low-carbon Mining Solutions Integration
opportunities.description: Mining technology and environmental engineering companies can propose the introduction of low-emission vehicles, green processing technologies, or remote monitoring in IHC's critical resources and mining units to accelerate decarbonization.
roadmap_steps: Identify best practices in sustainable mining technology
Outline integration plan with IHC's mining operations
Pilot low-emission or green tech solutions on select mining sites
Gather ESG performance data for IHC reporting
Collaborate for broader rollout

opportunities.title: AI-powered ESG Training and Workforce Enablement
opportunities.description: Educational technology and corporate training companies that specialize in AI-driven learning can collaborate with IHC to develop training programs for employees and leadership across subsidiaries to spur ESG adoption and awareness, using digital platforms.
roadmap_steps: Identify top digital ESG training vendors
Map IHC’s workforce learning needs by subsidiary
Co-create AI-based ESG training modules
Pilot with initial employee cohorts
Measure knowledge improvements and iterate

title: Launch of Altérra, the World’s Largest Climate Investment Fund
description: In 2023, Altérra was launched as the world’s largest climate investment fund with a $30 billion commitment from the UAE. Managed by Lunate, a subsidiary of 2PointZero, Altérra aims to stimulate $250 billion for climate action by 2030, acting as a bridge connecting ideas with action, private and public capital, and developed and emerging markets to drive transformative climate-focused investments.

opportunities.title: Green Technology Providers Partnering for Funded Pilots
opportunities.description: Companies developing innovative climate-related technologies (such as carbon capture, energy storage, or green hydrogen) can propose pilot projects to be funded under Altérra’s investment initiatives. By showcasing scalable solutions, these companies can secure funding and access global markets via the fund’s network. This is realistic due to the fund's explicit aim to bridge concepts with capital for transformative climate action.
roadmap_steps: Identify innovative projects or prototypes addressing climate challenges
Prepare technical documentation and pilot proposal
Align the proposal with Altérra’s climate impact criteria
Find and approach Lunate or Altérra’s program officers
Engage in due diligence and partnership negotiations

opportunities.title: Advisory Firms Supporting ESG Due Diligence
opportunities.description: Specialist ESG consulting firms can collaborate with Altérra to provide due diligence, impact assessment, or monitoring services for investments made by the fund. Their expertise ensures responsible investing in new ventures and helps satisfy transparency requirements set by global investors. This is feasible due to the complexity of environmental investments and growing regulatory scrutiny on impact.
roadmap_steps: Research Altérra’s focus areas and responsible investment framework
Develop tailored service offerings for ESG due diligence
Reach out to fund management and offer pilot consulting service
Demonstrate value through case studies and impact reports
Formalize a framework partnership

opportunities.title: Renewable Energy Project Developers Seeking Co-Investment
opportunities.description: Project development companies in wind, solar, geothermal, or bioenergy could engage with Altérra to seek co-financing for large-scale renewable installations in emerging or frontier markets. Given Altérra’s capital scale and mandate, such projects are a core investment target.
roadmap_steps: Identify shovel-ready clean energy projects
Develop detailed project business case and financial models
Align projects with Altérra’s investment criteria
Contact fund managers responsible for deal sourcing
Negotiate term sheets and co-investment partnership

opportunities.title: Clean Tech Startups Leveraging Corporate Accelerator Support
opportunities.description: Early stage clean technology startups from outside the listed entities could join or propose accelerator programs in collaboration with Altérra, aiming for mentorship, funding, and connections to international investors and markets. Altérra’s bridging ambition creates a pathway for global talent integration.
roadmap_steps: Identify fit with accelerator themes and Altérra’s strategic goals
Submit application or proposal for tailored acceleration
Develop partnership plan with accelerator operators
Engage in cohort activities and investor demo days
Scale validated technology via access to Altérra’s network

opportunities.title: Data Analytics Companies Enhancing Climate Impact Measurement
opportunities.description: Specialized data analytics and software companies could partner to design tools helping Altérra and its portfolio companies track and report climate impact or investment performance. With increasing demand for transparent measurement, this adds strong value.
roadmap_steps: Develop or adapt analytics platform for investment-related climate data
Demonstrate capabilities with case studies aligned to Altérra’s interests
Engage with fund managers or portfolio companies for pilot projects
Customize product for portfolio-wide integration
Support ongoing analytical reporting and enhancements

title: Formation of 2PointZero Holding Company with AED 100 Billion Asset Size
description: In 2024, IHC announced the initiation of 2PointZero, a next-generation holding company with an expected asset size exceeding AED 100 billion. This business combination consolidates multiple dynamic businesses across sectors under common control, creating a powerful platform for growth and innovation aligned with sustainable and responsible investment philosophy.

opportunities.title: Technology Integration and Digital Transformation Solutions
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in advanced digital transformation or enterprise software solutions can partner with 2PointZero to streamline operations across its newly consolidated businesses. This is realistic because large-scale holding companies often require integrated digital infrastructure for ERP, data analytics, cybersecurity, and workflow automation, which external technology providers can deliver efficiently.
roadmap_steps: Analyze 2PointZero's portfolio and digital maturity
Identify technology pain points across sectors
Build a customized digital transformation proposal
Contact key decision-makers in 2PointZero's IT management
Arrange pilot or demonstration projects

opportunities.title: Sustainable Energy Solutions for Asset Operations
opportunities.description: Clean tech companies can provide renewable energy systems, energy efficiency audits, or carbon reduction strategies to 2PointZero as part of its commitment to sustainable and responsible investment. Since the holding company prioritizes sustainability at scale, collaborating with external clean energy or environmental tech providers is both realistic and aligned with their strategic goals.
roadmap_steps: Research 2PointZero's sustainability strategy
Map assets and identify energy-intensive operations
Develop a project proposal with measurable ROI
Connect with 2PointZero's ESG or operations leads
Initiate feasibility studies and pilot projects

opportunities.title: Specialized Investment Products or Co-Investment Opportunities
opportunities.description: Investment firms can design co-investment vehicles or specialized financial products that align with 2PointZero’s portfolio diversification or growth objectives. This is realistic because large holding companies frequently seek external partners for sector expertise, risk sharing, or access to new markets while expanding their asset base.
roadmap_steps: Identify investment focus areas of 2PointZero
Develop co-investment frameworks
Reach out to 2PointZero's investment team
Arrange exploratory meetings
Negotiate deal structures and terms

opportunities.title: Corporate Sustainability and ESG Advisory Services
opportunities.description: Firms with expertise in ESG consulting and sustainability reporting can collaborate with 2PointZero to help shape, monitor, and communicate its responsible investment philosophy. This is realistic given growing stakeholder expectations for ESG transparency in large, diversified investment groups.
roadmap_steps: Assess 2PointZero's current ESG disclosures
Identify regulatory requirements and best practices
Propose a full ESG advisory package
Engage decision-makers in corporate governance
Initiate implementation and training workshops

title: IHC’s 2024 Sustainable Investment Approach and ESG Integration
description: In 2024, IHC emphasized embedding Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) considerations into its investment decision-making processes and sector-specific operations. This approach aims to safeguard value, mitigate risks, and deliver measurable environmental and social impact, reinforcing IHC's role as a responsible investor committed to sustainable growth and positive community impact.

opportunities.title: ESG Data Analytics Platform Integration
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in ESG data analytics and reporting platforms can partner to provide IHC with real-time ESG performance tracking, reporting, and benchmarking tools custom-tailored to their portfolio. This supports IHC's goal to measure and communicate environmental and social impact with precision, offering transparent tracking of key metrics for both internal use and stakeholders.
roadmap_steps: Research IHC’s current ESG reporting requirements
Identify mutual benefits for product integration
Develop a tailored presentation/proposal for IHC
Initiate contact with IHC’s sustainability or innovation team
Arrange pilot project or demo session
Collaborate on data security and compliance review

opportunities.title: Clean Technology Deployment Partnerships
opportunities.description: Clean technology solution providers (e.g., renewable energy, water efficiency, waste management) can propose pilot projects or scalable deployments across IHC’s sectoral operations. This directly supports IHC’s measurable environmental impact goals and risk mitigation strategies within their sustainable investment framework.
roadmap_steps: Review IHC’s sector focus and sustainability targets
Identify gaps or areas for clean technology application
Design a value-focused proposal/pilot project for IHC
Secure environmental certifications as needed
Initiate discussions with IHC’s ESG or operations teams
Set up pilot implementation and performance review

opportunities.title: ESG Investment Training and Capacity Building
opportunities.description: Firms specializing in ESG training, education, or certification can offer tailored workshops and capacity building for IHC’s management and portfolio companies. This enhances their ability to integrate ESG factors into decision-making, aligns with global best practices, and strengthens IHC’s claim as a responsible investor.
roadmap_steps: Assess IHC and portfolio management needs in ESG knowledge
Design modular training or certification programs
Prepare a case study of impact for similar investors
Reach out to IHC’s human resources and leadership development contact
Propose pilot training workshop or virtual seminar
Evaluate and refine based on participant feedback

opportunities.title: Community Impact Assessment Collaboration
opportunities.description: Social impact and community engagement consultancies can partner with IHC to design and implement advanced community impact assessments prior to new investments or expansions. These assessments improve community relations and directly support IHC’s commitment to positive social outcomes.
roadmap_steps: Identify types of IHC investments affecting local communities
Develop innovative assessment methodologies
Compile portfolio of successful community engagement projects
Present tailored impact package to IHC
Establish pilot assessment on selected project
Gather feedback and expand scope if successful

title: IHC Acquires Nearly 15% Stake in Grupo Nutresa
description: In 2024, IHC acquired a nearly 15% stake in Grupo Nutresa, a leading Latin American food production company known for its sustainability and social responsibility initiatives. This investment aligns with IHC's goal to advance global food security and responsible business practices in the food sector by integrating ESG principles into its portfolio.

opportunities.title: Launch Sustainable Packaging Solutions with Grupo Nutresa
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in eco-friendly packaging materials can partner with Grupo Nutresa to co-develop new, sustainable packaging tailored for the Latin American market. Given Grupo Nutresa’s commitment to ESG and sustainability, it is realistic to propose a joint venture or pilot program to reduce food product packaging waste and improve the environmental profile of their logistics.
roadmap_steps: Analyze Grupo Nutresa’s product portfolio and packaging needs
Develop proposal for environmentally friendly packaging alternatives
Reach out to Grupo Nutresa’s sustainability team with case studies
Arrange pilot trial for select products/regions
Collect performance data and environmental impact results
Negotiate long-term supply agreement based on outcome

opportunities.title: Supply Chain Traceability Tech Integration
opportunities.description: Technology companies specializing in blockchain or IoT traceability can collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to implement end-to-end digital tracking solutions. This addresses ESG criteria by enhancing food safety, reducing fraud, and showcasing transparent sourcing practices to consumers and investors.
roadmap_steps: Research Grupo Nutresa's current supply chain systems
Design a tailored traceability tech solution
Develop a business case demonstrating benefits (cost savings, ESG impact)
Engage Grupo Nutresa’s digital transformation or procurement teams
Offer pilot implementation for high-value or at-risk products
Iterate and expand contract upon success

opportunities.title: Sustainable Raw Ingredient Sourcing Program
opportunities.description: Agricultural cooperatives or sustainable farming consultancies can partner with Grupo Nutresa to develop certified sustainable sourcing programs for key raw ingredients, such as coffee, cocoa, or palm oil. This collaboration strengthens ESG efforts and supports local farming communities.
roadmap_steps: Identify key raw ingredients sourced by Grupo Nutresa
Map existing local suppliers and certification gaps
Draft proposal for a sustainable sourcing partnership
Engage CSR and purchasing departments at Grupo Nutresa
Launch training and certification pilot with select farmer groups
Scale program and monitor ESG KPIs

opportunities.title: Employee Wellness and Nutrition Program Partnerships
opportunities.description: Health and wellness companies focused on nutrition, healthy eating, or corporate wellness can collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to design and implement workplace wellness programs across their factories and offices. Such partnerships align with Nutresa’s ESG priorities, improving employee wellbeing and engagement.
roadmap_steps: Research Grupo Nutresa’s workforce demographics
Develop customized employee wellness program and menu options
Create an outreach pitch to Grupo Nutresa’s HR and CSR leaders
Pilot the program at a flagship facility or HQ
Measure and report on health outcomes and employee feedback
Position for company-wide rollout

opportunities.title: Carbon Footprint Reduction Consulting for Food Manufacturers
opportunities.description: Environmental consulting companies can offer carbon auditing and reduction programs to help Grupo Nutresa measure, report, and decrease its scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions throughout the food production and distribution process, directly contributing to its ESG targets.
roadmap_steps: Review Grupo Nutresa’s current sustainability and ESG reports
Assess emission hotspots across operations and supply chain
Develop a comprehensive carbon reduction plan
Present an engaging pitch with case studies to Grupo Nutresa’s sustainability executives
Execute on-site audits and recommend action steps
Monitor and report on carbon reduction progress

title: Grupo Nutresa Launches Major Cocoa Supply Chain Program
description: Grupo Nutresa, in partnership with the Colombian government, launched a major program to develop the country's cocoa supply chain, including establishing a nursery for ten million cacao trees, farmer training, and committing to purchase cacao from 15,000 new hectares over 10 years with an investment of USD 37 million targeting sustainable and profitable cocoa farming.

opportunities.title: AgriTech Collaboration for Data-Driven Cocoa Farming Solutions
opportunities.description: AgriTech companies can partner to provide Grupo Nutresa and Colombian cocoa farmers with digital platforms for real-time crop monitoring, precision agriculture solutions, and yield optimization tools. These solutions support efficient nursery management, disease detection, and data-driven training—fitting the large scale of the cocoa supply chain program and boosting sustainable outputs.
roadmap_steps: Conduct market assessment for local technological needs
Build a proposal for tailored AgriTech platforms
Initiate discussions with Grupo Nutresa and government stakeholders
Pilot digital solutions with selected farmer groups
Scale up deployment across the cacao supply program

opportunities.title: Sustainable Packaging Solutions for Cocoa Supply Chain
opportunities.description: Sustainable packaging companies can collaborate to introduce biodegradable or reusable packaging specifically designed for cacao bean transport and storage. This addresses the environmental impact of large-scale agricultural initiatives and aligns with Grupo Nutresa's sustainability commitments.
roadmap_steps: Research packaging needs in cacao transport
Develop prototypes for sustainable packaging
Reach out to Grupo Nutresa's supply chain team
Test solutions in the distribution network
Negotiate procurement and scale up production

opportunities.title: Renewable Energy Deployment for Cocoa Processing Facilities
opportunities.description: Renewable energy firms have an opportunity to offer solar or biomass energy solutions to reduce the carbon footprint of cacao nurseries and processing facilities, supporting both cost efficiency and sustainability goals.
roadmap_steps: Conduct energy audits of cocoa facilities
Design suitable renewable energy systems
Collaborate with Grupo Nutresa and local stakeholders
Implement pilot installations
Provide ongoing monitoring and maintenance services

opportunities.title: Financial Services for Smallholder Cocoa Farmers
opportunities.description: Fintech or microfinance companies can customize loan, insurance, or digital banking offerings to empower cocoa farmers entering the supply chain, enabling investments in training, better tools, and initial nursery inputs.
roadmap_steps: Map out financial barriers for new cocoa farmers
Develop tailored financial products and risk models
Partner with local cooperatives and Group Nutresa
Launch targeted pilot programs
Scale to reach additional farmer communities

opportunities.title: Global Cocoa Traceability & Certification Platform Integration
opportunities.description: Companies specializing in traceability solutions can collaborate to implement digital tracking and certification systems, ensuring transparency in sustainable sourcing from nursery to final product. This meets increasing consumer and market demands for traceable, ethical products.
roadmap_steps: Identify traceability requirements and industry standards
Develop or adapt digital tracking solutions
Integrate with Grupo Nutresa's supply chain processes
Train farmers and logistics staff on usage
Monitor compliance and release marketing insights

title: Grupo Nutresa's Community Development Investment
description: Grupo Nutresa invested USD 45.7 million in community development, supporting local projects with volunteerism involving over 15,800 participants and 51,300 volunteer hours, focusing on social and environmental well-being.

opportunities.title: Partnership with Educational Organizations for Community Training
opportunities.description: Companies in the education sector can collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to design and deliver training programs for local communities, focusing on essential skills, food safety, nutrition, or sustainability. This would leverage the existing infrastructure and volunteer involvement already in place, providing tangible benefits to the community and aligning with both parties' social impact goals.
roadmap_steps: Identify relevant educational organizations with community outreach programs
Contact community development or ESG departments at Grupo Nutresa
Propose curriculum integration or co-hosted workshops
Define clear roles for volunteers and trainers
Monitor and assess impact together

opportunities.title: NGO Collaboration for Environmental Restoration Initiatives
opportunities.description: Environmental NGOs could join forces with Grupo Nutresa for targeted restoration projects in the local area, making use of the existing volunteer base and funding schemes. Efforts might include tree planting, river clean-up, or biodiversity protection, directly leveraging Nutresa's commitment to environmental well-being.
roadmap_steps: Pinpoint local environmental needs matching Nutresa’s focus
Reach out to Nutresa’s ESG contacts
Present a joint action plan for restoration projects
Coordinate volunteer logistics and material needs
Set up shared monitoring and public reporting

opportunities.title: Collaboration with Health Service Providers for Wellness Campaigns
opportunities.description: Healthcare providers can collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to create volunteer-driven wellness campaigns (such as nutrition workshops, health check-ups, or mental health support) for local communities, harnessing Nutresa’s volunteer network and funding capacity.
roadmap_steps: Map health needs within targeted communities
Approach Grupo Nutresa’s community outreach coordinator
Outline campaign objectives and logistics
Arrange training sessions for volunteers
Measure participation and community impact

opportunities.title: Tech Integration for Volunteer Impact Tracking
opportunities.description: Tech companies with expertise in data or social impact measurement can partner with Grupo Nutresa to develop digital solutions that track and report on volunteer hours, project outcomes, and community benefits, enhancing the transparency and effectiveness of Nutresa’s investment.
roadmap_steps: Develop an outline of tech solutions for volunteer tracking
Connect with Grupo Nutresa’s CSR or IT teams
Propose a pilot project integrating new platforms
Coordinate data collection and training
Launch system and refine based on feedback

opportunities.title: Supply Chain Sustainability Partnerships with Local Agri-businesses
opportunities.description: Local agriculture and farming businesses can work with Grupo Nutresa to implement sustainable practices within the supply chain, supported by community investment and volunteer engagement, elevating both social and environmental outcomes.
roadmap_steps: Identify local agri-businesses aligned with Nutresa’s sourcing
Engage Nutresa’s supply chain and CSR teams
Jointly audit current practices and opportunities
Co-design volunteer-involved sustainability initiatives
Track and report on supply chain improvements

title: Grupo Nutresa Employee Welfare and Farmer Training Programs
description: Grupo Nutresa provides employees an average of 54.66 training hours annually and trained 15,000 small farmers in social, environmental, and production topics to promote sustainable agricultural practices and community well-being.

opportunities.title: AgriTech Solutions for Sustainable Farming Education
opportunities.description: Develop and implement digital tools (apps, e-learning modules) tailored to Grupo Nutresa’s farmer training programs, enabling scalable and interactive delivery of agricultural best practices to farmers. This opportunity is realistic as Grupo Nutresa is already engaged in farmer education, presenting a need to modernize and expand their reach and efficiency.
roadmap_steps: Research the current content and delivery methods used in Grupo Nutresa’s farmer training
Develop pilot digital education tools tailored to identified needs
Initiate contact with Grupo Nutresa’s sustainability or training team
Propose a joint pilot project
Assess pilot results and scale successful solutions

opportunities.title: Customized Health & Nutrition Workshops for Employee Well-being
opportunities.description: Design and deliver specialized health and nutrition workshops integrated into Grupo Nutresa’s employee training regime to enhance overall workplace wellness. Grupo Nutresa’s commitment to employee training provides an entry point for companies specializing in workplace health solutions to deliver subject matter expertise.
roadmap_steps: Create targeted health and nutrition curriculum for food industry employees
Identify key HR and training decision-makers at Grupo Nutresa
Arrange introductory meetings to showcase the value of holistic wellness workshops
Pilot the workshop series within one business unit
Collect feedback and refine for company-wide implementation

opportunities.title: Environmental Monitoring Solutions for Sustainable Agriculture
opportunities.description: Deploy environmental assessment and monitoring technologies to evaluate the impact of farming practices taught through Grupo Nutresa's farmer training initiatives, ensuring continuous improvement and compliance with sustainability goals. This enhances transparency and effectiveness of training outcomes for all stakeholders.
roadmap_steps: Assess training curriculum for opportunities to integrate environmental monitoring
Develop a proposal highlighting measurable sustainability benefits
Engage with Grupo Nutresa’s ESG and sustainability contacts
Run a pilot project with a subset of trained farmers
Analyze data and demonstrate value for expanded adoption

opportunities.title: Certification Programs for Social and Environmental Practices
opportunities.description: Introduce third-party certification programs for farmers trained by Grupo Nutresa, enabling them to gain recognized credentials in sustainable and socially responsible agriculture. This adds value to both Grupo Nutresa and the farmers by demonstrating commitment to industry standards and market differentiation.
roadmap_steps: Develop certification criteria aligned with Grupo Nutresa’s training content
Establish partnerships with international or local certification bodies
Present the value proposition to Grupo Nutresa’s training managers
Pilot the certification process with selected farmer groups
Expand to full program rollout upon successful assessment

title: Grupo Nutresa Supports Education and Youth Employment
description: Grupo Nutresa supports education through Fundación Nutresa impacting 546 schools, grants over 420 university scholarships (60% to women), and hires 5,101 young individuals aged 18 to 28 directly to promote youth employment and economic independence.

opportunities.title: EdTech Platforms for School Enrichment Programs
opportunities.description: EdTech companies can partner with Grupo Nutresa and Fundación Nutresa to provide digital learning solutions, interactive content, and teacher training to the 546 schools supported, modernizing classrooms and improving educational outcomes.
roadmap_steps: Research school profiles and needs in Fundación Nutresa’s network
Develop a tailored proposal for EdTech support and digital learning materials
Contact Fundación Nutresa's partnership office
Conduct pilot programs in select schools
Evaluate impact and expand to more schools based on results

opportunities.title: Job Placement and Internship Platforms for Youth
opportunities.description: Employment platforms or career services can collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to match young job seekers (18-28) with internships or entry-level positions, complementing the company's hiring efforts and increasing youth economic independence.
roadmap_steps: Analyze Grupo Nutresa’s youth hiring practices and requirements
Design partnership for co-branded internships or job fairs
Establish data-sharing agreements and job posting integration
Launch targeted recruitment campaigns for youth candidates
Monitor placement rates and adjust matching algorithms as needed

opportunities.title: STEM and Entrepreneurship Scholarship Program Providers
opportunities.description: Organizations managing university scholarships—specifically focused on STEM and entrepreneurship—can collaborate with Fundación Nutresa to offer additional scholarships, mentorship, and enrichment workshops to female students, leveraging the company's 60% female scholar demographic.
roadmap_steps: Identify overlapping scholarship target groups with Fundación Nutresa
Propose joint scholarship and mentorship packages
Coordinate application and selection processes
Integrate enrichment and networking activities
Track graduate outcomes and continuous improvement

opportunities.title: Food Industry Suppliers for School Nutrition and Awareness Campaigns
opportunities.description: Food product or service suppliers can partner with Grupo Nutresa and Fundación Nutresa to develop healthy eating programs, supply nutritious meals, or run awareness campaigns in the large network of schools impacted by the foundation.
roadmap_steps: Assess nutritional needs of partner schools
Design products or services tailored to school environments
Engage with Fundación Nutresa’s school coordinators
Develop and implement meal plans or campaigns
Measure student health and participation outcomes

opportunities.title: NGOs Specializing in Rural Education Development
opportunities.description: Non-governmental organizations with expertise in rural school development can collaborate with Fundación Nutresa to expand infrastructure, digital access, or teacher capacity in underserved communities among their 546-school network.
roadmap_steps: Identify gaps in rural education among target schools
Propose collaborative projects to Fundación Nutresa
Secure funding and outline implementation plans
Deploy resources for infrastructure or training
Monitor and report on impacts in target areas

opportunities.title: Youth Leadership and Soft Skills Training Organizations
opportunities.description: Training companies focused on leadership, communication, or soft skills can offer workshops and programs to young employees recruited by Grupo Nutresa, aiming to improve work readiness, productivity, and retention.
roadmap_steps: Engage with Grupo Nutresa’s HR or youth employment departments
Develop training modules tailored to entry-level employees
Implement pilot sessions with young hires
Collect feedback from participants and managers
Scale up the program based on outcomes

title: Grupo Nutresa Delivers Over 1,790 Tons to Food Banks
description: Contributing to food security, Grupo Nutresa donated more than 1,790 tons of products to food banks benefiting over 1.5 million people in Colombia and strategic regions in 2024.

opportunities.title: Logistics Solutions for Food Donation Distribution
opportunities.description: Partner with Grupo Nutresa to offer advanced logistics and transportation services to optimize the delivery of donated food to food banks and remote communities. Efficient supply chain management can improve the reach and freshness of food products, reducing waste and ensuring timely support for beneficiaries. This is realistic because Grupo Nutresa already has established donation programs and expanding logistics support can directly amplify their impact.
roadmap_steps: Identify main delivery challenges faced by current food donation distribution.
Develop a tailored logistics proposal addressing efficiency and cost savings.
Contact Grupo Nutresa's CSR or operations department to present logistics partnership opportunity.
Establish pilot projects in select regions to demonstrate impact.
Scale up support based on performance data and feedback.

opportunities.title: Nutritional Product Development for Food Bank Programs
opportunities.description: Collaborate with Grupo Nutresa to develop affordable, nutritious meal packages or fortified foods specifically designed for donation to food banks, catering to the nutritional needs of vulnerable populations. This opportunity is realistic as food banks often lack specialized products that meet the dietary requirements of different groups such as children, elderly, or those with specific health needs.
roadmap_steps: Research nutritional gaps and needs among food bank beneficiaries.
Develop prototypes of fortified and affordable food products.
Present product concepts to Grupo Nutresa’s social responsibility team.
Pilot product distribution through selected food banks.
Iterate based on feedback and scale production as needed.

opportunities.title: Food Bank Technology Platform Integration
opportunities.description: Integrate food bank operations with a technology platform to track inventory, donations, and beneficiary data, improving transparency and resource allocation. Grupo Nutresa can partner with companies specializing in digital platforms for non-profits to streamline food distribution and reporting processes. This is realistic due to growing digital transformation in CSR activities and the logistics complexity of large-scale donations.
roadmap_steps: Assess current digitalization level of food bank partners.
Design or select a suitable technology platform for tracking and reporting.
Demonstrate platform benefits to Grupo Nutresa and food bank partners.
Facilitate onboarding and training for food bank staff.
Monitor usage and improve system based on user feedback.

opportunities.title: Awareness Campaign & Volunteer Program Partnership
opportunities.description: Work with Grupo Nutresa to create and manage nationwide volunteer mobilization and awareness campaigns supporting food security initiatives. A marketing or communications company could coordinate volunteering events, sponsor awareness drives, and maximize outreach, leveraging Grupo Nutresa’s established brand. This makes sense as Grupo Nutresa is already committed to food security, and amplifying engagement through professional management will enhance their social impact.
roadmap_steps: Propose a strategic campaign plan focused on food security and volunteering.
Align messaging and goals with Grupo Nutresa’s social responsibility agenda.
Recruit and train volunteers for various regions and events.
Launch campaign through multi-channel platforms.
Track engagement metrics and adjust strategies for maximum impact.

title: Nutresa Exemplary Supplier Program Strengthens Supply Chain
description: For nine consecutive years, Grupo Nutresa’s ‘Nutresa Exemplary Supplier’ program promoted social, environmental, and economic sustainability practices among 2,500 suppliers across 8 LATAM countries, delivering over 1,000 feedback reports from more than 2,000 applications to encourage supplier sustainability.

opportunities.title: Third-Party Auditing Services for Supplier Program
opportunities.description: Offer independent third-party auditing and verification services to suppliers participating in the Nutresa Exemplary Supplier Program to validate their sustainability claims, provide actionable improvement feedback, and help enhance transparency. This is realistic as suppliers often seek external validation to improve credibility and meet program requirements.
roadmap_steps: Research Nutresa Exemplary Supplier Program requirements
Identify key pain points and strengths in supplier sustainability reporting
Develop audit and verification packages tailored to regional suppliers
Reach out to supplier management teams with proposals
Provide pilot audits and gather testimonials for credibility

opportunities.title: Sustainable Packaging Solutions for LATAM Suppliers
opportunities.description: Provide innovative, eco-friendly packaging technologies and materials to Grupo Nutresa suppliers looking to improve their sustainability and environmental impact. This is realistic as the supplier network is explicitly encouraged to adopt green practices, and demand for sustainable packaging continues to rise in the food industry.
roadmap_steps: Analyze current packaging practices of Nutresa’s supplier base
Design or source eco-friendly packaging alternatives
Develop targeted partnerships or pilot programs
Contact suppliers through Nutresa program channels
Monitor results and adjust offerings based on supplier feedback

opportunities.title: Supplier Sustainability Training and Certification
opportunities.description: Deliver specialized online or in-person training and certification services to help Nutresa’s suppliers improve their ESG performance. This makes sense because many suppliers will be seeking to differentiate themselves and increase their chances of excelling in the program.
roadmap_steps: Develop curriculum based on Nutresa’s sustainability requirements
Partner with local experts for regional relevance
Promote training programs through supply chain networks
Offer certification upon completion of coursework
Track certified suppliers’ performance in Nutresa program

opportunities.title: Data Management and Analytics Platform for Supplier Performance
opportunities.description: Introduce a digital platform that helps suppliers collect, analyze, and report sustainability metrics aligned with Nutresa’s feedback requirements. This is realistic as digitization of ESG reporting can streamline the process for thousands of suppliers across multiple countries.
roadmap_steps: Identify data points required by Nutresa’s reporting system
Develop user-friendly multi-lingual digital dashboard
Pilot the platform with select suppliers in key LATAM markets

title: Multiply Group Develops ESG Integration Framework
description: In 2024, Multiply Group developed an ESG Integration Framework to provide a clear and systematic approach for integrating ESG factors into their investment decisions and stewardship of portfolio assets. The structured framework governs ESG policy establishment, position development on key ESG factors, and delegation of ESG responsibilities to executive committees.

title: Multiply Group Awarded Low Risk ESG Risk Rating by Sustainalytics
description: Multiply Group received an ESG Risk Rating of 16 by Sustainalytics in 2024, categorizing the Group as 'Low Risk'. This rating reflects the Group's effective management of ESG risks and commitment to long-term value creation and positive impact across its portfolio and global community.

title: Multiply Group Invests AED 1 Billion Across Three Acquisitions
description: In 2024, Multiply Group invested approximately AED 1 billion in three acquisitions across its strategic verticals, reinforcing its presence in Mobility, Energy and Utilities, Media and Communications, and Beauty and Wellness sectors.

title: Emirates Driving Company Receives Provisional AAA MSCI ESG Rating
description: Emirates Driving Company (EDC), a portfolio company of Multiply Group, was awarded a provisional AAA ESG rating from MSCI in early 2024, scoring 9.7 out of 10 and ranking in the top 9% within its industry.

title: Viola Communications Certified as 'Great Place to Work' in 2024
description: Viola Communications, a Multiply Group portfolio company, was certified as a 'Great Place to Work' in 2024 with a 90% overall satisfaction score. It was recognized among the top workplaces in the GCC's media, advertising, and marketing sectors, and earned awards for Best Workplaces for Women and Best Workplaces in the Middle East.
companies_mentioned: Great Place to Work Middle East

title: BackLite Media Achieves 'Great Place to Work' Certification in 2024
description: BackLite Media, another portfolio company of Multiply Group, received official 'Great Place to Work' certification in 2024 and ranked #9 on the Best Workplaces in Media, Advertising and Marketing list by Great Place to Work® Middle East.
companies_mentioned: Great Place to Work Middle East

title: Kalyon Enerji Awarded International Green Apple Environmental Award 2024
description: Kalyon Enerji, part of Multiply Group’s portfolio, was awarded the 2024 International Green Apple Environmental Award for Sustainable Green Energy recognizing its contributions to renewable energy and environmental sustainability.

title: Multiply Group Plans GHG Emissions Baseline and Social Impact Assessment for 2025
description: Looking ahead to 2025, Multiply Group plans to establish a baseline for greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions to enable emissions monitoring and reporting segmented by business vertical. The Group also intends to initiate a social impact assessment for each employee to gauge broader societal and workforce impacts.

title: Launch of Century Village Project for Worker Accommodation
description: ESG subsidiary launched Century Village on Al Reem Island, a AED 360 million project providing dignified co-living housing for 5,500 residents including recreational spaces, wellness facilities, and dining areas, addressing workforce housing needs in Abu Dhabi.

title: Implementation of Occupational Health and Safety Management System
description: ESG employs a comprehensive Occupational Health and Safety Management System featuring risk assessments, hazard identification, and regular training to ensure workplace safety and foster a culture of vigilance across its operations.

title: Adoption of Estidama Pearl Rating and LEED Standards in Real Estate Projects
description: ESG integrates Estidama Pearl Rating System and LEED standards in its real estate developments such as Reem Hills in Abu Dhabi and Albizya Bay in Seychelles to prioritize energy efficiency, water conservation, and sustainable material use.

title: Environmental Initiatives including Mangrove Planting and Recycling Programs
description: ESG launched several environmental initiatives such as restoring coastal ecosystems through mangrove planting, running recycling programs for materials like wood, sawdust, paper, plastic, and glass led by Vision Furniture & Decoration Factory LLC, and collaborative waste management efforts with Tadweer.

title: Staff Accommodation Wellness Facilities and Services
description: ESG provides integrated healthcare access and wellness programs in staff accommodations, including onsite clinics, fitness facilities, and hygiene campaigns to promote employee health and well-being.

title: Launch and Development of Reem Hills Sustainable Community in Abu Dhabi
description: The Reem Hills Project by IHC represents a commitment to sustainable, luxurious, and eco-friendly communities in Abu Dhabi. It aligns with the Emirates vision for sustainability and environmental preservation, adhering to the Estidama Pearl Rating System (PBRS, PVRS, PCRS) focusing on resource efficiency and long-term sustainability throughout design, construction, and operational phases.

title: Partnership with Q Holding for Century Village Worker Living and Sustainability Project
description: IHC, in partnership with Q Holding, is undertaking the AED 360 million Century Village project aimed at improving worker living conditions and advancing sustainable real estate practices. This initiative integrates environmental responsibility with social progress to promote ESG objectives in real estate development.

title: Launch of ESG Hospitality for Sustainable Tourism
description: IHC has launched ESG Hospitality as a strategic move into sustainable tourism, prioritizing eco-conscious construction and operations. This initiative supports global sustainability trends and reinforces IHC's commitment to responsible and sustainable practices within the hospitality industry.

title: Launch of Active Hub program in Abu Dhabi schools
description: In February 2022, Abu Dhabi Sports Council, Emirates Schools Establishment, and Palms Sports launched the 'Active Hub' program to provide public access to sports facilities in Abu Dhabi schools after working hours. The program includes classes in 13 sports disciplines, has registered over 104,000 members and more than 870,000 attendance occurrences, and receives an average 86.7% member satisfaction rate.

title: Palms Sports hosts 10 UAE Warriors MMA Championship fight nights
description: Palms Sports organized 10 fight nights for the UAE Warriors MMA Championship, establishing Abu Dhabi as a global hub for mixed martial arts. The platform enables athletes to showcase talents, gain international recognition, and secure sponsorships from UFC, Bellator, and One Championship.

title: Esyasoft entry into European market via Electrica SA Romania partnership
description: Esyasoft expanded into the European market in 2024 through a strategic partnership with Electrica SA Romania. The collaboration supports advanced green energy production and the transition to sustainable energy systems using AI and IoT technology.

title: Esyasoft acquisition of 70% stake in Float IoT
description: Esyasoft acquired a 70% stake in Float IoT, a Netherlands-based company specializing in water meter reading services and remote asset monitoring. This acquisition expands Esyasoft's portfolio into smart water technology solutions, combining Float IoT's expertise with AI-driven digital twinning solutions to enhance global water management.

title: Palms Sports launches UAE Warriors Vocational Jiu-Jitsu Camps

description: In 2024, Smart Sustainability Solutions (S3), a climate-focused company under IHC, signed a Strategic Collaboration Agreement with SOCAR Green and VEMA SA at COP29 in Baku. The collaboration aims to deploy climate-friendly solutions in Azerbaijan’s energy sector with a focus on methane abatement, carbon capture, circular economy initiatives, and water sustainability.

title: Apeiro Healthcare Digital Transformation Project
description: In 2024, Apeiro, a subsidiary of Sirius International Holding, initiated a project with the Social Health Authority (SHA) aimed at advancing healthcare equity and efficiency. The project focuses on digital transformation of public healthcare facilities by implementing cloud-based solutions to improve accessibility, reduce operational inefficiencies, and optimize resource allocation for universal health coverage.

title: Aldar Launches Net Zero Plan
description: In January 2023, Aldar launched its Net Zero Plan outlining targets and actions to achieve net zero emissions across all scopes by 2050, making it a cornerstone of its sustainability strategy.

title: Aldar Operationalizing Solar PV Projects
description: Aldar Properties is operationalizing a solar PV project across 45 assets to generate 12%-15% of energy demand and significantly reduce emissions from purchased electricity.

title: Launch of Integrated Waste Management Plant by Aldar
description: Aldar will complete and operationalize the first integrated waste management facility in Abu Dhabi aiming for zero waste to landfill within the first year of operation.

title: Aldar's Updated Net Zero Strategy in 2024
description: Building on improved data quality and a new 2023 baseline, Aldar will update its net zero strategy in line with the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) and Buildings Sector Guidance.

title: Aldar Achieves High Sustainability Standards in 2024 Projects
description: In 2024, Aldar achieved 80% of new projects rated 3 Pearl in Estidama, 100% assessed construction and consultancy contracts for sustainability, and 100% of projects had a minimum Fitwel 2 Star rating.

title: Aldar Invests AED 113 Million to Retrofit 67 Assets
description: Aldar invested AED 113 million to retrofit 67 assets, of which 23% received LEED certification ranging from Gold to Platinum, enhancing energy efficiency and sustainability.

title: Aldar Real Estate Decarbonization Pledge Growth
description: The Aldar Real Estate Decarbonization Pledge, launched in 2023, grew to over 70 signatories in 2024, including 60% of top contractors with about 50% having emissions targets or developing them.

title: PureHealth Achieves 13.2% Reduction in Total Emissions in 2023
description: PureHealth, the UAE’s largest integrated healthcare network, achieved a 13.2% reduction in total GHG emissions in 2023, equivalent to approximately 90,344 MTCO2e, compared to its baseline year. This was part of their Net Zero 2040 targets and involved improved GHG emissions tracking and reporting, renewable energy adoption, digital healthcare solutions promoting virtual care, and supply chain sustainability enhancements.

title: Deployment of IoT-Driven Energy and Efficiency Solutions at PureHealth in 2024
description: In 2024, PureHealth advanced its decarbonization efforts by deploying IoT-driven energy and efficiency solutions across prioritized healthcare facilities. This enabled real-time monitoring of energy consumption and identification of inefficiencies for optimized resource utilization, enhancing their sustainability and Net Zero goals.

title: Trojan Construction Group achieves provisional 'A' MSCI ESG rating
description: Trojan Construction Group became the first construction group in the Middle East to achieve a provisional 'A' rating in the MSCI ESG assessment as of March 07, 2024, reflecting its leadership in sustainable construction and commitment to advancing sustainability in the industry.

title: Trojan Construction Group partners with Etihad Rail to introduce hybrid fleets
description: Trojan Construction Group partnered with Etihad Rail to introduce hybrid fleets into its operations in 2023, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and minimize environmental impact across its value chain as part of its sustainability efforts.

title: Phoenix Timber Factory LLC achieves FSC certification compliance
description: Phoenix Timber Factory LLC, a subsidiary of Trojan Construction Group, achieved 70% FSC-certified wood products in the last reporting year and maintained 100% compliance with FSC standards when sourcing high-risk species, reinforcing responsible sourcing and sustainable forestry practices.

title: NMDC Group Achieves AA 'Leader' ESG Rating
description: NMDC Group received a provisional AA 'Leader' ESG rating from MSCI on March 7, 2024, recognizing its effective environmental stewardship, social responsibility, and governance governance practices. This rating places NMDC Group among leaders in the Construction & Engineering sectors and sets a benchmark for industry peers.

title: NMDC Group Reports Strong Financial Performance in 2024
description: In 2024, following the success of its 2021 merger, NMDC Group reported a 44% increase in net profit to AED 3.11 billion, a 57% increase in revenue to AED 26.26 billion, and a 36% rise in earnings per share to AED 3.55, reflecting robust market evolution capitalization.

title: NMDC Group Expands Renewable Energy Projects Including Offshore Wind
description: NMDC Group is expanding its renewable energy footprint by partnering with Byrne Equipment Rental to implement solar energy systems at Sir Baniyas Island residential camp, reducing CO2 emissions by 475 tons yearly. The Group is also developing, constructing, and maintaining Taiwan's Yunlin offshore wind farm and recently acquired a Dynamic Positioning vessel to boost offshore wind projects, expected to generate annual revenue exceeding AED 1 billion.

title: NMDC Group Targets International Expansion in Offshore Wind and Subsea Installation
description: NMDC Group plans to expand internationally into subsea rock installation for offshore wind farms, rigs, breakwaters, and subsea pipeline protection. This diversification supports its renewable energy portfolio and environmental sustainability by integrating advanced renewable solutions.

title: Burjeel Holdings Achieves Provisional AAA MSCI ESG Rating in 2024
description: Burjeel Holdings, a leading healthcare provider in the UAE, Oman, and Saudi Arabia, embedded ESG principles into its operations, including developing a dedicated ESG strategy, comprehensive disclosures, and advanced waste management systems. In 2024, it obtained a provisional AAA ESG rating from MSCI, highlighting exceptional performance in environmental, social, and governance dimensions such as operational emissions reductions, workforce diversity, community healthcare initiatives, and transparent governance. Burjeel plans future initiatives focusing on carbon neutrality, waste reduction, expanded healthcare accessibility, and stronger governance frameworks.

title: EDC Earns Provisional AAA ESG Rating from MSCI
description: In March 2024, Emirates Driving Company (EDC) achieved a provisional AAA ESG rating from MSCI, placing it among the top 9% of companies in the consumer services industry. This rating highlights EDC's leadership in sustainability, social responsibility, governance, and its capability to manage risks and opportunities for long-term value.

title: EDC Introduces ESG Transformation Program
description: In 2023, Emirates Driving Company launched the ESG Transformation Program called 'Towards a Sustainable Future,' reinforcing its commitment to corporate governance, behavior change, and advancing progress toward Net-Zero emissions aligned with the UAE Net Zero by 2050 Initiative.

title: EDC Validated Science-Based Net-Zero Targets by SBTi
description: During the 2024 reporting year, Emirates Driving Company had its science-based Net-Zero targets validated by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi), reinforcing its ambition and commitment to achieving meaningful climate goals.

title: EDC Acquires Excellence Driving and Updates Net-Zero Plan
description: Following its acquisition of Excellence Driving, Emirates Driving Company plans to update and validate its Net-Zero Plan in alignment with its sustainability goals and initiatives, strengthening its corporate ESG posture.

title: EDC to Implement Sustainable Procurement and ESG Certifications
description: Emirates Driving Company will activate sustainable procurement procedures by establishing baselines with Tier 1 suppliers and embedding ESG principles throughout its value chain. It also aims to achieve key certifications and renewals, including renewing its MSCI ESG rating and pursuing ESG 1000 Certification to strengthen its leadership in sustainability.

title: Mawarid Holding Investment Achieves Provisional MSCI ESG Rating and Dubai Chamber ESG Label
description: In 2024, Mawarid Holding Investment (MHI) received its provisional MSCI ESG rating of BBB, providing valuable insights into growth areas. Additionally, MHI was awarded the Dubai Chamber of Commerce ESG Label at the advanced maturity level, marking significant progress in embedding ESG principles into its operations.

title: MHI Automates GHG Emissions Management with Third-Party Carbon Consulting
description: In 2024, Mawarid Holding Investment advanced its greenhouse gas emissions management by automating data collection and calculations through a third-party carbon emissions consulting firm that linked emissions accounting to MHI’s ERP system. MHI also completed the Global Compact Climate Ambition Accelerator program, setting science-based emission reduction targets aligned with a 1.5°C pathway towards net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: MHI Engages Suppliers on ESG Performance and Compliance
description: MHI initiated stakeholder engagement in 2024 with its top 30 suppliers by purchase value to evaluate their ESG maturity through self-assessment questionnaires. Suppliers were required to comply with MHI’s business policies and ethical codes. About 67% of suppliers, representing 70.5% of total spend value, confirmed compliance, forming part of MHI's continuous ESG improvement efforts.

title: MHI Expands Waste Diversion and Resource Efficiency Initiatives
description: During 2024, MHI increased its waste diversion efforts by sending waste batteries and electronic waste (WEEE) totaling 46,482 kg and 19,004 kg respectively to licensed recycling firms. The organization reduced single-use plastic water bottle usage by 75.7% via refillable dispensers and cut photocopy paper purchases by 22.6% through an implemented print management system, further enhancing sustainability and circular economy practices.

title: Publication of IHC ESG Report 2024
description: IHC has published its Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Report for the year 2024, detailing the company's sustainability initiatives, social responsibility commitments, and governance practices.

title: Publication of IHC ESG Report 2024
description: IHC has published its ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) Report for the year 2024, highlighting the company's commitment to sustainability integrated into its operations. The report emphasizes sustainable practices in governance, resource management, community engagement, and innovative solutions aimed at creating long-term value beyond financial returns.

title: Establishment of Task Force for Recovery of Outstanding Receivables
description: IHC established a dedicated task force in 2024 to accelerate the recovery of outstanding receivables, ensuring financial momentum and liquidity, while reinforcing accountability and mitigating legal and financial risks.

title: Advancement of AED 5 Billion Share Buyback Program
description: In 2024, IHC advanced its AED 5 billion share buyback program by acquiring AED 1.8 billion worth of shares during the quarter, also introducing targeted debt refinancing measures to reduce high debt costs and ensure long-term financial sustainability.

title: Introduction of Aiden Insight, an AI-Powered Board Observer
description: IHC deployed Aiden Insight, an AI-powered Board Observer in May 2024, which provides real-time data analysis, predictive guidance on market trends, operational efficiencies, and emerging business opportunities, enhancing corporate governance and strategic decision-making.

title: Re-election of Board Members and Board Composition Highlight
description: In April 2023, five members of IHC's Board of Directors were re-elected for a three-year term, including maintaining one female member on the Board since April 2020, reflecting IHC's commitment to diversity at the leadership level.

title: Appointment of Dr. Mohamed Somar Ajalyaqin as Vice Chairman of IHC
description: In April 2020, Dr. Mohamed Somar Ajalyaqin was appointed Vice Chairman of IHC, bringing nearly two decades of experience in corporate strategy, mergers and acquisitions, and business growth initiatives essential for IHC's expansion and investment strategy.

title: Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan appointed Chairman of IHC and leadership roles expansion
description: Since April 2020, Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan has served as Chairman of IHC, expanding it into one of the world’s largest investment firms. He also holds leadership roles as Deputy Ruler of Abu Dhabi and Chairman of the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) since March 2023, and chairs ADQ, G42, MGX, and the Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council (AIATC) as of January 2024.
tags: Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan
Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Technology Council

title: Appointment of Sofia Lasky to IHC Board and strategic acquisitions
description: Sofia Lasky was appointed to IHC's board in April 2020, contributing extensive expertise in asset management, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, and corporate structuring. She has led acquisitions across real estate, contracting, food processing, preventive healthcare, and capital investments.
companies_mentioned: National Corporation for Tourism and Hotels

title: Syed Basar Shueb's leadership as CEO and Managing Director of IHC
description: Since 2019, Syed Basar Shueb has served as CEO and Managing Director of IHC, driving strategic foresight, operational excellence, and bold investments resulting in exponential growth, global presence, and a diversified portfolio. He is recognized as a top CEO and sustainability leader in 2024.

title: Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi appointed Board Member of IHC and strategic relations role
description: Mohammed Nasser Al Shamsi was appointed Board Member of IHC in April 2020. He is an International Affairs Specialist at Presidential Level in the UAE Ministry of Presidential Affairs, managing strategic relations with foreign governments, diplomatic missions and international institutions.

title: Establishment of IHC Board Committees for Governance and Management
description: IHC has established several board committees to enhance governance and operational oversight. These include the Audit Committee focusing on financial reporting, risk management, and ethics; the Nomination and Remuneration Committee responsible for recommending board and senior management memberships and remuneration; and the Follow-Up & Supervision Committee of Insiders Transactions which monitors insider transactions and compliance with market regulations.

title: Updated Risk Management Policies Reviewed by Board
description: IHC reviewed and updated its risk management policies in light of the Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA) changes introduced in January 2024. The updated policies aim to ensure alignment with the highest standards of governance and compliance and are under review by the Board of Directors.

title: Partnership with Teneo for Crisis Communications Playbook
description: IHC partnered with Teneo to develop a comprehensive Crisis Communications Playbook, including a Rapid Response Guide designed to handle potential crises and protect the company’s reputation. This initiative is part of IHC’s proactive approach to mitigating reputational risks and operational disruptions.

title: Implementation of Advanced Data Privacy and Security Measures
description: In 2024, IHC formed a partnership with its subsidiary Emircom to strengthen data privacy and security. The implementation includes controls such as email security, Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), Data Leakage Prevention (DLP), role-based access control (RBAC), user awareness programs, advanced SASE features, SOC enhancements, and proactive security assessment and testing.

title: Mitigation of 42 Cyberattacks with Zero Data Breaches in 2024
description: Since onboarding a new service provider in October 2024, IHC has successfully mitigated 42 attempted cyberattacks and maintained a 100% success rate with zero data breaches, reflecting the effectiveness of its enhanced cybersecurity measures and monitoring.

title: Development of Baseline Operational GHG Inventory
description: IHC began developing a baseline operational greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions inventory in 2024 to enhance environmental accountability. The inventory focuses on emissions at the parent level and includes Scope 1, Scope 2, and relevant Scope 3 categories excluding investments (Category 15).

title: Partnership with REE™ for Responsible Waste Management
description: IHC partnered with REE™, a software company specializing in bespoke recycling solutions, to revolutionize workplace waste management by enhancing transparency and traceability using a real-time dashboard. The initiative included staff education workshops and introduced a tech-based waste recycling solution empowering employees to actively participate in waste segregation.

title: Energy and Water Audit by Reset Energy Subsidiary
description: Reset Energy, a subsidiary of IHC, conducted an energy and water audit in 2023 at IHC Headquarters, resulting in a 23% reduction in consumption. Implemented solutions included adiabatic cooling for chillers, optimized HVAC controls, upgraded lighting and controls, state-of-the-art building management system, and cloud-based analytics platform for monitoring energy savings.

title: Issuance of Guidelines for Management of Insider Information
description: IHC issued comprehensive guidelines to all Business Units regarding trading of securities and management of insider information to uphold highest standards of integrity and compliance within subsidiaries, joint ventures, and affiliates organized into 8 distinct verticals.

title: IHC Workforce and Diversity Updates 2024
description: In 2024, IHC reported a diverse workforce of 49 employees representing 22 nationalities. There was a 15% increase in Emirati employees in senior-to-executive positions and a 6% increase in female employees overall, indicating progress toward gender diversity and national talent development. The company provides attractive compensation and benefits, regular performance reviews for all employees, and supports work-life balance evidenced by parental leave usage and return to work.

title: IHC Achieves Zero Health and Safety Incidents in 2024
description: IHC reported zero health and safety incidents in their office during the reporting year 2024. The company ensures full compliance with all relevant laws and regulations governing health and safety, protecting the well-being of workers, contractors, and visitors across their offices and worksites.

title: IHC Partners with Active Abu Dhabi, Pura, and Sanimed for Employee Well-being Initiatives
description: IHC formed partnerships with Active Abu Dhabi and Pura to empower employees' health through AI-powered analysis of blood reports and activity levels. Additionally, IHC collaborated with Sanimed to support mental health and stress management for employees, focusing on comprehensive well-being through tailored activities.

title: IHC Commits to Increasing Spending on Local Suppliers in UAE in 2024
description: In line with UAE's goals to support local industry and reduce import dependency, IHC increased its engagement with local suppliers to 50% in 2024, spending AED 6,625,000, which represents 17.75% of their overall expenditure. This initiative supports economic growth and sustainability within the UAE.

title: IHC Advances Diversity, Inclusion and Non-Discrimination Policies
description: IHC maintains a zero-tolerance policy against intimidation, harassment, or discrimination of any kind. Their Group Code of Conduct promotes fair and equal treatment of all employees regardless of race, gender, ethnic origin, nationality, religion, age, or physical ability, fostering a safe, inclusive, and equitable work environment.

title: IHC Engages in Corporate Social Responsibility Initiatives in Education and Healthcare
description: IHC embraces CSR by contributing to charitable initiatives, sponsorships, and targeted programs in education and healthcare. The company aligns its CSR efforts with national priorities and global challenges to positively impact community development and sustainability.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Released with Employee Demographics Data
description: IHC published its ESG Report for 2024 detailing comprehensive employee demographics, including total employees by job category, age group, and gender distribution for the years 2022 to 2024. The report provides data segmented into entry-level, mid-level, and executive to senior-level categories, highlighting changes in gender ratios and age groups over the three years.

title: IHC ESG Report 2024 Released
description: IHC published its ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) report for the year 2024, detailing workforce demographics including total number of nationalities rising from 15 in 2022 to 22 in 2024, female to male remuneration ratios at various management levels, new hire statistics by gender and age groups, attrition percentages, incidents of discrimination reported as zero, Emiratisation metrics showing stable Emirati employee numbers with no incidents of discrimination, and overall workforce turnover and hire rates.

title: Publication of IHC ESG Report 2024
description: IHC published its ESG Report for the year 2024 detailing Emirati employee percentages by seniority, community support contributions, and a comprehensive emissions overview including Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas emissions. The report outlines direct and indirect energy consumption, waste generation, and the methodology used for calculating emissions. It also highlights IHC's procurement spending on local suppliers and Emiratization rates.
